intro: Aposeris, commonly known as the "false dandelion," is a genus of flowering plants in the family Asteraceae. These plants are characterized by their bright yellow flowers and are often found in arid or semi-arid regions. Aposeris species typically have a basal rosette of leaves and produce small, dandelion-like seeds that are dispersed by the wind. They are adapted to dry environments and often have hairy or waxy leaves to reduce water loss. The genus includes several species, some of which are used in traditional medicine.
